title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a weekly quiz to test readers' knowledge of Greater Boston news.
Peter Chianca, Boston.com's general assignment editor, oversees the quiz published on October 31, 2025.
The quiz covers trending stories and keeps readers informed about local news developments.

title: Marco Sturm’s faith in Marat Khusnutdinov gets rewarded with Bruins OT winner
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marat Khusnutdinov scored the overtime winner as the Boston Bruins defeated the Buffalo Sabres 4-3.
Khusnutdinov was promoted to the top line and played 15:20, impressing coach Marco Sturm with his resilience.
Elias Lindholm left the game with a lower-body injury, leading Khusnutdinov to take on the center role.

title: Why Dan Orlovsky believes Drake Maye is NFL MVP frontrunner
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots QB Drake Maye credited with team's 6-2 start by key performances and leadership.
Dan Orlovsky argues Maye should be NFL MVP over Jonathan Taylor for his pivotal role.
Maye has third-best MVP odds with 15 TD passes, 2,026 yards, and 75.2% completion rate.

title: Brookline farm starts free farmers market as Mass. residents brace for SNAP shutdown
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Allandale Farm starts free farmers market at Loring Greenough House, Jamaica Plain, due to SNAP shutdown concerns.
Iggy's Bread partners with Allandale Farm to provide free bread during November market days.
Governor Maura Healey announces increased support for food banks and new SNAP resource hub amid ongoing government shutdown.

title: $9,000 in donations stolen from Catholic church in Watertown, police say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: $9,000 in donations stolen from St. Patrick's Church in Watertown on October 27 after 5:30 p.m.
The theft was reported to Watertown police the following morning around 8:30 a.m.
Police have not released suspect details and urge anyone with information to contact Detective Joe Kelland.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm exits game with lower-body injury
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm exited the Bruins' game against the Sabres with a lower-body injury after a collision with Jordan Greenway.
Lindholm did not return for the rest of the game, and his status remains uncertain according to coach Marco Sturm.
Marat Khusnutdinov, shifting to center in Lindholm's absence, scored the overtime winner against the Sabres.

title: David Ortiz offers up advice to Mookie Betts amid World Series slump
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Ortiz advises Mookie Betts to have fun amid his World Series slump with the Dodgers.
Betts is batting .130 during the Fall Classic as the Dodgers face elimination against the Blue Jays.
In Game 5, the Dodgers' top hitters struggled, going 1-for-15 with eight strikeouts against the Blue Jays.

title: Irish firefighter found guilty of raping woman in Boston hotel, sentenced to 7-9 years in prison
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Terence Crosbie, 39, an Irish firefighter, was sentenced to 7-9 years in prison for raping a woman in a Boston hotel.
The rape incident occurred in March 2024 during Crosbie's visit to Boston for St. Patrick's Day events as part of the Dublin Fire Brigade.
Crosbie plans to appeal, claiming jury mistakes, despite evidence like key card data and DNA linking him to the crime scene.

title: Brockton man allegedly in US illegally sentenced to prison for raping 14-year-old girl
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Erickson Barbosa, a 32-year-old from Brockton, sentenced to 7 years for raping a 14-year-old girl in 2020.
Barbosa pleaded guilty and was sentenced in Fall River Superior Court; he also faces 5 years probation post-release.
Originally from Cape Verde, Barbosa may face deportation after serving his sentence due to illegal U.S. residency.

title: ‘Special stuff’: Why Patriots CB Marcus Jones’s October was one to remember
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Marcus Jones signed a three-year contract extension with the New England Patriots effective in October 2025.
He was named AFC Defensive Player of the Month after standout performances, including a key interception against the Bills.
Jones excelled as a returner, ranking third in NFL punt return yards with notable performances against the Panthers.
